title: New architecture and design competitions: Seoul Government Complex, GOAT-LAB, UIA – HYP Architecture Students Cup, and Architecture After the Fires: LA in Progress
author: Nathaniel Bahadursingh
excerpt: This edition of Bustler's curated picks of noteworthy architecture and design competitions features four calls seeking proposals for a new, integrated Yeongdeungpo-gu Office Complex in Seoul, South Korea, innovative wooden climbing tower designs for goats, student-driven reinterpretations of...
text: anchor A panoramic view of the site for the new Yeongdeungpo-gu Government Office Complex in Seoul, South Korea. An international design competition is seeking proposals for this new revamped complex. The details are below. Image: Yeongdeungpo-gu Competition This edition of Bustler's curated picks of noteworthy architecture and design competitions features four calls seeking proposals for a new, integrated Yeongdeungpo-gu Office Complex in Seoul, South Korea, innovative wooden climbing tower designs for goats, student-driven reinterpretations of forgotten or overlooked spaces, and architectural plans and concepts for the zones recently impacted by the Los Angeles wildfires. For the complete directory of newly listed competitions, click here. International Design Competition for the New Yeongdeungpo-gu Government Office ComplexRegistration Deadline: Tuesday, July 22, 2025Submission Deadline: Friday, September 26, 2025"The Yeongdeungpo-gu Office Main Building is classified as an aging building, completed 49 years ago in 1976, and ongoing repair costs are incurred to prevent safety incidents and maintain facilities. Due to the cramped main building relative to growing administrative demand, facility operations have been dispersed across two annex buildings, causing inconvenience to the public and reducing administrative efficiency. Therefore, an integrated government office complex that organically links all facilities is required. Along with performing administrative tasks, the complex seeks to provide public services that support local residents’ cultural, educational, and community activities. By selecting from a wide range of ideas and works from both home and abroad, this project aims to foster pride among Yeongdeungpo-gu residents by creating a regional landmark with creative and symbolic design." GOAT-LAB Summer SchoolRegistration/Submission Deadline: Friday, July 25, 2025"GOAT-LAB: fatuk and t-lab invite architecture students to take part in an open competition to design an innovative climbing tower for goats – sustainable, reversible, and built from regional timber. The winning design will be realised during a one-week Design-Build Summer School in the Diemerstein Valley. [...] Particular attention will be paid to the sustainability, reversibility and innovative nature of the timber connections." The UIA – HYP ARCHITECTURE STUDENTS CUP 2025Registration Deadline: Saturday, September 20, 2025Submission Deadline: Friday, October 10, 2025"Architecture has the power to reveal what’s hidden. The UIA – HYP ARCHITECTURE STUDENTS CUP 2025 invites students worldwide to reimagine forgotten or overlooked spaces — the nooks and crannies — as sites of transformation. This competition is more than a design challenge; it’s an invitation to engage deeply with the spaces that surround us — to observe, interpret, and act with freedom and creativity. Open to students only, this competition is an opportunity to share old projects or create new ones." Image: SCI-Arc Call for Submissions — Architecture After the Fires: LA in ProgressRegistration/Submission Deadline: Friday, July 18, 2025"SCI-Arc's Resilient Futures Task Force is opening a call for submissions of architectural plans and concepts in the zones recently affected by wildfires. The multi-day event showcases the current state of architectural adaptation as it unfolds under conditions of heightened fire risk. Works of any typology are accepted, and we invite submissions of in-progress projects as well as speculative or research-oriented works."Would you like to contribute competitions, award programs, or calls for submissions that aren't listed on Bustler yet? Send them directly to our team to review. We may include them in our next roundup. Some current competitions on Bustler that may interest you... MICROHOME / Edition #10 Register by Thu, Jul 17, 2025 Submit by Wed, Oct 29, 2025 Re:Form – New Life for Old Spaces Register by Thu, Jul 24, 2025 Submit by Tue, Sep 2, 2025 Denver Affordable Housing Challenge Register by Thu, Jul 17, 2025 Submit by Mon, Oct 20, 2025 LAST CALL / Best House in The World competition / 111.000€ IN PRIZES Register/Submit by Fri, Jul 4, 2025
html:
• anchor

    A panoramic view of the site for the new Yeongdeungpo-gu Government Office Complex in Seoul, South Korea. An international design competition is seeking proposals for this new revamped complex. The details are below. Image: Yeongdeungpo-gu Competition

    This edition of Bustler's curated picks of noteworthy architecture and design competitions features four calls seeking proposals for a new, integrated Yeongdeungpo-gu Office Complex in Seoul, South Korea, innovative wooden climbing tower designs for goats, student-driven reinterpretations of forgotten or overlooked spaces, and architectural plans and concepts for the zones recently impacted by the Los Angeles wildfires. 

    For the complete directory of newly listed competitions, click here.

    International Design Competition for the New Yeongdeungpo-gu Government Office Complex
    Registration Deadline: Tuesday, July 22, 2025
    Submission Deadline: Friday, September 26, 2025

    "The Yeongdeungpo-gu Office Main Building is classified as an aging building, completed 49 years ago in 1976, and ongoing repair costs are incurred to prevent safety incidents and maintain facilities. Due to the cramped main building relative to growing administrative demand, facility operations have been dispersed across two annex buildings, causing inconvenience to the public and reducing administrative efficiency. Therefore, an integrated government office complex that organically links all facilities is required. Along with performing administrative tasks, the complex seeks to provide public services that support local residents’ cultural, educational, and community activities. By selecting from a wide range of ideas and works from both home and abroad, this project aims to foster pride among Yeongdeungpo-gu residents by creating a regional landmark with creative and symbolic design."

    GOAT-LAB Summer School
    Registration/Submission Deadline: Friday, July 25, 2025

    "GOAT-LAB: fatuk and t-lab invite architecture students to take part in an open competition to design an innovative climbing tower for goats – sustainable, reversible, and built from regional timber. The winning design will be realised during a one-week Design-Build Summer School in the Diemerstein Valley. [...] Particular attention will be paid to the sustainability, reversibility and innovative nature of the timber connections."

    The UIA – HYP ARCHITECTURE STUDENTS CUP 2025
    Registration Deadline: Saturday, September 20, 2025
    Submission Deadline: Friday, October 10, 2025

    "Architecture has the power to reveal what’s hidden. The UIA – HYP ARCHITECTURE STUDENTS CUP 2025 invites students worldwide to reimagine forgotten or overlooked spaces — the nooks and crannies — as sites of transformation. This competition is more than a design challenge; it’s an invitation to engage deeply with the spaces that surround us — to observe, interpret, and act with freedom and creativity. Open to students only, this competition is an opportunity to share old projects or create new ones."

    Image: SCI-Arc

    Call for Submissions — Architecture After the Fires: LA in Progress
    Registration/Submission Deadline: Friday, July 18, 2025

    "SCI-Arc's Resilient Futures Task Force is opening a call for submissions of architectural plans and concepts in the zones recently affected by wildfires. The multi-day event showcases the current state of architectural adaptation as it unfolds under conditions of heightened fire risk. Works of any typology are accepted, and we invite submissions of in-progress projects as well as speculative or research-oriented works."

    Would you like to contribute competitions, award programs, or calls for submissions that aren't listed on Bustler yet? Send them directly to our team to review. We may include them in our next roundup.


    Some current competitions on Bustler that may interest you...

    MICROHOME / Edition #10

    Register by Thu, Jul 17, 2025

    Submit by Wed, Oct 29, 2025

    Re:Form – New Life for Old Spaces

    Register by Thu, Jul 24, 2025

    Submit by Tue, Sep 2, 2025

    Denver Affordable Housing Challenge

    Register by Thu, Jul 17, 2025

    Submit by Mon, Oct 20, 2025

    LAST CALL / Best House in The World competition / 111.000€ IN PRIZES

    Register/Submit by Fri, Jul 4, 2025
